Answer the questions given below (refer Fig.1):


Fig. 1. Circuit configuration of 3-phase Controlled Rectifier.


1. The output voltage of a 3-phase rectifier is:

answers.a: DC and it is controlled by source voltage only.
answers.b: AC and it is controlled by source voltage only.
answers.c: DC and it is controlled only with firing angle.
answers.d: DC and it is controllable with source voltage and firing angle both.

explanations.d: Explanation 4: For the three-phase controlled rectifier the average output voltage is This expression clearly indicates that average output voltage is dependent on both the source voltage and firing angle.

questions.question: 2. The DC output voltage of a 3-phase bridge rectifier is:

explanations.b: Explanation 2: It is a six-pulse rectifier and hence output voltage waveform exhibits 6-pulse waveform.

questions.question: 3. A 50 Hz, 3-phase balanced AC supply is given to a 3-phase controlled rectifier.  What will be the frequency of output load voltage?

explanations.c: Explanation 3: Fequency of output voltage will be six times of the supply frequency.

questions.question: 4. For what firing angle(s) the DC output voltage of a 3-phase fully-controlled bridge rectifier is negative?

explanations.d: Explanation 4: From this expression for firing angle higher than 90 degree the output voltage will be negative.

questions.question: 5. What will be the frequency of the firing pulse of any one thyristor of 3-phase controlled bridge rectifier?

explanations.b: Explanation 2: Each thyristor is turned-ON only once in each AC input voltage cycle. Hence, the thyristor firing pulse frequency is same as supply frequency.
